name: places/ChIJlfgEWYBZwokRGSzGbsmUSGI
adrFormatAddress: 501 5th Ave #1601, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: I recently did laser and Botox treatments here. I felt quite nervous about the procedures at the beginning since it’s my first time. But the doctors and nurses here are very nice and professional. Within just one week, I noticed significant improvements in my facial appearance. I highly recommend this establishment to anyone considering similar treatments.

originalText.text: I was pretty nervous about going to the Medspa for the first time, but the staff there were just so nice and accommodating. They took the time to chat with me and explain all the different treatments, especially since I was worried about my pigmentation. Ended up going for the laser treatments, and I’m very happy with how it’s turning out. After just three sessions, my freckles are already starting to fade, and my skin looks so much brighter. I can’t wait to see how it all looks after I finish up my last couple of sessions!

originalText.text:
This review is for Botox at Clear Laser. I’ve been going to this clinics for facials, laser treatments and Botox for the last 2 years. I’d always had a great experience with good results until this year, when 2 of my 3 Botox treatments left me with significant unevenness.

In March, I went in for a standard forehead and masseter Botox treatment. To my surprise and without me asking, the doctor decided to inject a few units in my chin for a chin dimple. I initially wrote this off as a miscommunication and didn’t think much of it, but a week later, I was left with a noticeably crooked smile that lasted for months. The unevenness was honestly horrifying.

I came back in November, again for forehead and masseter Botox, but this time with Dr. Hong. He suggested I get a few units in my chin, for my chin dimpling. I told him I wasn’t interested, given I was scarred from my last experience.  Dr. Hong reassured me it wouldn’t affect my smile and went ahead and injected a few units. One week later, to my horror, my smile was crooked…again, along with my brows.

I had to push the clinic multiple times to come in for touchup. I came in a week later and Dr. Hong mostly fixed my smile, but a week after the touchup, I’m now left with one eyelid that is drooping significantly…

I contacted the clinic today to get advice on my new eyelid droopiness, and have yet to hear back.  There seems to be no sense of urgency for botched Botox results.

Overall, I’ve completely lost trust in the clinic. The NP that previously worked here was wonderful - she was extremely meticulous and always left me with perfect results. I’m disappointed that I can no longer depend on Clear Laser for my Botox treatments.

originalText.text: I began my forehead botox at Clear about two years ago. During the initial counseling, I wanted to do lots of things. But they honestly recommended what to do and what not to do. I ended up waiting for a while till make up my mind. XD I finally did Ulthera last week and Jane was amazing! I can't wait to see the results!

originalText.text: I’ve been getting Botox from this place for the past year. The doctor explains how many units I need before the procedure and why/where It needs the most. I was always satisfied with the results and I’ve recommended this place to my family and friends. The price is reasonable and the happy hour deal is amazing which is definitely plus!
